location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 299 of 1850 from Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to His Excellency Colonel Justin Sheil, Her Majesty's Minister Plenipotentiary and Envoy Extraordinary at the Court of Persia

mods.abstract: The letter concerns the slave trade on the Arab coast. It encloses translated extracts of correspondence sent by the Native Agent at Sharjah, Moollah Houssein [MullƒÅ Husayn], dated 14 June 1850, reporting the names of merchants from Lingah [Bandar-e Lengeh] suspected of being involved in the slave trade.
